cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles east-southeast of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the north-western Gulf coast (Louisiana/Texas border area) early next week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (near or just east of the TX-LA border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Punta Herrero to Cancun, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Punta Herrero to Dzilam, Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and north-western Gulf coast from Yucatan Peninsula northward to Texas and Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph, higher gusts) possible late Tuesday into early Wednesday if the track shifts slightly west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along the upper Texas coast, especially around Sabine Pass.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches of rain possible with locally higher amounts in outer rain-bands Tuesday–Wednesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in rain-bands and brief visibility reductions affecting vessel traffic.
